meanings.definition: A substance that causes irritation or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: The strong perfume was an irritant to my sensitive nose.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise from the construction site was an irritant to the residents.
meanings.sent3: The constant buzzing of the mosquito was an irritant during the peaceful picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her constant nagging was like an irritant slowly wearing away his patience.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy fabric of the sweater felt like an irritant against her skin.

meanings.definition: Something that provokes impatience or anger.
meanings.sent1: The long wait at the doctor's office was an irritant to the already frustrated patients.
meanings.sent2: His sarcastic remarks were an irritant that fueled her anger.
meanings.sent3: The slow driver in front of him became an irritant on his rushed morning commute.
meanings.sent4: The constant interruptions during the meeting were an irritant to the speaker's train of thought.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet was like an irritant slowly driving him to madness.
